alert.note: Alert for Grayson (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 6:00PM EDT by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 730 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county, Grayson. * WHEN...Until 730 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain had ended, but runoff from the earlier heavy rain will likely keep streams running high, with low lying flooding expected, especially west of Mouth of Wilson. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Fox Creek, Grassy Creek, New River, Wilson Creek and Bear Branch. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Mouth Of Wilson... Volney... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.
